result.execSummary:
The defendant Shawn L Overton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Court will waive any costs and surcharges that can be waived. Court ordered the defendant to pay any costs and surcharges that can not be waived.
Submit DNA sample.

Establish paternity for any minor children.
Successfully complete a parenting class.

AODA assessment/treatment deemed appropriate.
Maintain absolute sobriety to be monitored by random urine screens.

records.addlTxt: Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 24. lr  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 08-17-2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Daniel E Meylink in court, defendant Shawn L Overton not in court, in custody.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Court denied  defense motion for bail reduction. $500.00 cash to remain.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
Court ordered defendant to be monitored by Drug Testing
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: Keiwaun P -Dob: 8/26/94;;2514 W Auer Ave; Devante S - dob: 4/7/92.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

CASE RECALLED
Defendant Shawn L Overton in court with attorney Joel H. Rosenthal.  Defendant Shawn L Overton in custody.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.     Motion to dismiss Count 1 by defense argued and DENIED by the Court. Court preserves defendant's right to bring motion again before the trial court.Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  

DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for August 12, 2015 at 08:30 am. in Branch 47 for Branch 24.

Defendant Shawn L Overton in court with attorney Daniel E Meylink.  Defendant Shawn L Overton in custody.  
Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

CASE PASSED :  ADA does not have file.

ADDRESS INFO for Shawn L Overton
Current: 3230 W Center Street, Milwaukee, WI 53210   (Effective: 08-08-2015)
Prior: 3151 North 35th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53216
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Shawn L Overton not in court.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
OCCR Tape #15-101

Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is a possible victim identified, therefore, Court stays order of forfeiture with recompense to be determined at close of case.
Clerk:  jms
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 5/27/15 @ 1:30 pm
